instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Cant turn on,Fan not spinning,Charger indicator Orange
threads.message:
i have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A logic board,condition as title.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> at <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> pin 1 = 1.663v

resistance mode
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> at <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> pin 1 to L7310 pin 1 = 45.0ohm slowly increasing
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> at <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> pin 1 to GND = 4.3ohm

any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Cant turn on,Fan not spinning,Charger indicator Orange
threads.message: Shorted <TRANSISTOR>Q7310</TRANSISTOR> and/or <TRANSISTOR>Q7320</TRANSISTOR>, replace both and pray, maybe CPU is toasted....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Cant turn on,Fan not spinning,Charger indicator Orange
threads.message: No, if <TRANSISTOR>Q7310</TRANSISTOR>/20 was shorted the resistance from PPBUS to L7310 would always be lower than PPBUS to GND. Something else is shorted, check resistance from PPBUS to all the coils and see if any are lower than that 4.3 Ohm. If you cannot find that you can inject voltage on PPBUS and see if anything heats up.
